tests.name: Single datapoint test - FIFO
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi
tests.run: VAL=$(awk -F, '$1 == "0.096" { print $2 }' BIMDC/14.csv); strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i f -p 14 -t 0.096 -e 1 >temp 2>/dev/null; grep -qF -- ${VAL} temp && [ $(grep 'openat(AT_FDCWD, "fifo_control' trace.tst | wc -l) -eq $((2)) ]

tests.name: Multiple datapoint test - FIFO
tests.setup: mkdir received; make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi
tests.run: strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i f -p 9 >/dev/null 2>&1; head -n 1000 BIMDC/9.csv > test.csv; diff -wB test.csv received/x1.csv >/dev/null && [ $(grep 'openat(AT_FDCWD, "fifo_control' trace.tst | wc -l) -eq $((2)) ]

tests.name: Binary file transfer test - FIFO
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi; truncate -s 256K BIMDC/test.bin
tests.run: strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i f -f test.bin -m 512 >/dev/null 2>&1; diff BIMDC/test.bin received/test.bin >/dev/null && [ $(grep 'openat(AT_FDCWD, "fifo_control' trace.tst | wc -l) -eq $((2)) ]

tests.name: New channel test - FIFO (1)
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi
tests.run: NUMC=3; strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i f -c ${NUMC} -p 9 >/dev/null 2>&1; head -n 1000 BIMDC/9.csv > test.csv; for n in $(eval echo "{1..${NUMC}}"); do if ! diff -wB test.csv received/x$n.csv >/dev/null || [ $(grep 'openat(AT_FDCWD, "fifo_data' trace.tst | wc -l) -ne $((2*NUMC)) ]; then exit 1; fi; done; exit 0

tests.name: New channel test - FIFO (2)
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi
tests.run: NUMC=10; strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i f -c ${NUMC} -f 10.csv -m 1024 >/dev/null 2>&1; diff BIMDC/10.csv received/10.csv >/dev/null && [ $(grep 'openat(AT_FDCWD, "fifo_data' trace.tst | wc -l) -eq $((2*NUMC)) ]

tests.name: Single datapoint test - MQ
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi
tests.run: VAL=$(awk -F, '$1 == "0.096" { print $2 }' BIMDC/14.csv); strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i q -p 14 -t 0.096 -e 1 >temp 2>/dev/null; grep -qF -- ${VAL} temp && [ $(grep 'mq_open(' trace.tst | wc -l) -eq $((2)) ]

tests.name: Multiple datapoint test - MQ
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi
tests.run: strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i q -p 9 >/dev/null 2>&1; head -n 1000 BIMDC/9.csv > test.csv; diff -wB test.csv received/x1.csv >/dev/null && [ $(grep 'mq_open(' trace.tst | wc -l) -eq $((2)) ]

tests.name: Binary file transfer test - MQ
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi; truncate -s 256K BIMDC/test.bin
tests.run: strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i q -f test.bin -m 512 >/dev/null 2>&1; diff BIMDC/test.bin received/test.bin >/dev/null && [ $(grep 'mq_open(' trace.tst | wc -l) -eq $((2)) ]

tests.name: New channel test - MQ (1)
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi
tests.run: NUMC=3; strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i q -c ${NUMC} -p 9 >/dev/null 2>&1; head -n 1000 BIMDC/9.csv > test.csv; for n in $(eval echo "{1..${NUMC}}"); do if ! diff -wB test.csv received/x$n.csv >/dev/null || [ $(grep 'mq_open(' trace.tst | wc -l) -ne $((2*(NUMC+1))) ]; then exit 1; fi; done; exit 0

tests.name: New channel test - MQ (2)
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi
tests.run: NUMC=10; strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i q -c ${NUMC} -f 10.csv -m 1024 >/dev/null 2>&1; diff BIMDC/10.csv received/10.csv >/dev/null && [ $(grep 'mq_open(' trace.tst | wc -l) -eq $((2*(NUMC+1))) ]

tests.name: Single datapoint test - SHM
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi
tests.run: VAL=$(awk -F, '$1 == "0.096" { print $2 }' BIMDC/14.csv); strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i s -p 14 -t 0.096 -e 1 >temp 2>/dev/null; grep -qF -- ${VAL} temp && [ $(grep 'openat(AT_FDCWD, "/dev/shm/' trace.tst | wc -l) -eq $((10)) ]

tests.name: Multiple datapoint test - SHM
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi
tests.run: strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i s -p 9 >/dev/null 2>&1; head -n 1000 BIMDC/9.csv > test.csv; diff -wB test.csv received/x1.csv >/dev/null && [ $(grep 'openat(AT_FDCWD, "/dev/shm/' trace.tst | wc -l) -eq $((10)) ]

tests.name: Binary file transfer test - SHM
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi; truncate -s 256K BIMDC/test.bin
tests.run: strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i s -f test.bin -m 512 >/dev/null 2>&1; diff BIMDC/test.bin received/test.bin >/dev/null && [ $(grep 'openat(AT_FDCWD, "/dev/shm/' trace.tst | wc -l) -eq $((10)) ]

tests.name: New channel test - SHM (1)
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi
tests.run: NUMC=3; strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i s -c ${NUMC} -p 9 >/dev/null 2>&1; head -n 1000 BIMDC/9.csv > test.csv; for n in $(eval echo "{1..${NUMC}}"); do if ! diff -wB test.csv received/x$n.csv >/dev/null || [ $(grep 'openat(AT_FDCWD, "/dev/shm/' trace.tst | wc -l) -ne $((6*NUMC+10)) ]; then exit 1; fi; done; exit 0

tests.name: New channel test - SHM (2)
tests.setup: make -s clean; if ! make -s SHM >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s MQ >/dev/null 2>&1; then if ! make -s FIFO >/dev/null; then echo "make failed"; exit 1; fi; fi; fi
tests.run: NUMC=10; strace -e trace=mq_open,openat -o trace.tst ./client -i s -c ${NUMC} -f 10.csv -m 1024 >/dev/null 2>&1; diff BIMDC/10.csv received/10.csv >/dev/null && [ $(grep 'openat(AT_FDCWD, "/dev/shm/' trace.tst | wc -l) -eq $((6*NUMC+10)) ]
